Title.En: Swedish for Foreign Students - level A1

Description.En: The aim of the course is to give students a basic knowledge of Swedish with an emphasis on oral skills. The course includes pronunciation exercises, oral training, basic Swedish grammar and short, writing exercises. Learn to understand and use well-known, everyday expressions and very basic phrases, which all aim to meet concrete needs. Practice to present yourself, ask as well as answer and conduct simple conversation.

NoteLiteral.En: Conduct simple conversation, provided that the conversational partner speaks slowly and clearly, and is willing to help out.
Present herself/himself and others, and ask as well as answer questions relating to their own life such as where s/he lives, people s/he knows and things s/he owns.
Understand and use well-known, everyday expressions and very basic phrases, which all aim to meet concrete needs.

Title.En: Swedish for Foreign Students - level A1
Swedish for Foreign Students - level A1

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
We meet approximately once a week in a virtual classroom – a Zoom-room. Before each Zoom-session you need to work with the corresponding course book chapter on your own using a Step-by-Step guide and prepare the assignments listed in the guide. The Step-by-Step guides, the pre-recorded lectures and all other material you need throughout the course (except the course books and the corresponding audio files) are available in the Linköping University learning platform Lisam ([lisam.liu.se](https://lisam.liu.se)).

The course books used are **Rivstart A1-A2 – Textbook** (ISBN: 9789127434202) and **Exercise book** (ISBN: 9789127434219).

There are 11 Zoom-sessions (10 chapters + introduction), but they are not obligatory. Instead, there are 5 obligatory assignments (2 written assignments, 1 short film, 1 word-order test and 1 verb test) which need to be completed to pass the course. At the end of the course there is also an oral and a written exam, both of which are done online. In order to take part in the course you must have a computer with a stable internet connection, a headset (preferably USB) and a web cam so you can communicate with sound and image. 

For the syllabus of the module please see the [here](https://studieinfo.liu.se/en/kurs/714G45/ht-2024#overview).

This is an online beginner’s Swedish module which includes pronunciation exercises, reading, oral training, basic Swedish grammar and short writing exercises. After having completed the module, you should have basic knowledge of Swedish A1 in accordance with the Common European Framework of Reference (CEFR) for Languages.

**Deadline for applications**: Sunday, 11 August 2024

**Entry requirements:** No previous knowledge of Swedish required

All applicants have to submit a transcript of records during the application process.

You will receive a results notification within 5 days after the deadline. If admitted, you will receive instructions regarding the next steps in the process by the host university.
